285  int _id;
287  std::vector<Point> ps;
303  std::vector<char> ts;
304 
305  // @brief If used, denotes checkpoints through which the route travels
306  // and the relevant segment of the route.
307  //
308  // Set and used by the orthogonal routing code. Note the first value
309  // in the pair doesn't correspond to the segment index containing the
310  // checkpoint, but rather the segment or bendpoint on which it lies.
311  // 0 if on ps[0]
312  // 1 if on line ps[0]-ps[1]
313  // 2 if on ps[1]
314  // 3 if on line ps[1]-ps[2]
315  // etc.
316  std::vector<std::pair<size_t, Point> > checkpointsOnRoute;
317 
318  // Returns true if at least one checkpoint lies on the line segment
319  // or at either end of it.
320  std::vector<Point> checkpointOnSegment(size_t segmentLowerIndex) const;
321 };
